frc.robot

Class PIDControl

  • java.lang.Object
    • frc.robot.PIDControl

  • public class PIDControl
extends java.lang.Object
    Custom PID controller class to make pid work! Configurable items: p, i, d, scale, tolerance This class isn't for the most accurate pid in the world. Its to get the job done

    Bugs: None yet!

      • PIDControl

        public PIDControl(PIDSource inputSensor,
                  float p,
                  float i,
                  float d)
        Constructor for PIDControl, takes in input sensor and tuning values as floats.
        Parameters:
        inputSensor - Sensor that implements the PIDInput interface
        p - proportional tuning value
        i - integral tuning value
        d - differential tuning value

      • PIDControl

        public PIDControl(float p,
                  float i,
                  float d)
        Constructor for PIDControl. Use this if your encode does not implement PIDSource. (im watching you CANEncoder...)
        Parameters:
        p - proportional tuning value
        i - integral tuning value
        d - differential tuning value

    • Method Detail

      • setTolerance

        public void setTolerance(double tolerance)
        Determines how accurate pid has to be for it to return true for in range value
        Parameters:
        tolerance - the tolerance to set 0 <= tolerance <= 1. 0 = full tolerance, 1 - no tolerance

      • getValue

        public double getValue()
        Get value returned by pid calculations. Use this method if your get method returns error directly (limelight)
        Returns:
        double speed value

      • getValue

        public double getValue(double setpoint,
                       double currentValue)
        Get value returned by pid calculations. Use this method if the pidGet function is already taken or you need to use a custom value for input.
        Parameters:
        setpoint - where the pid input value should be
        current - value of the sensor
        Returns:
        double speed value

      • cleanup

        public void cleanup()
        Reset pid loop and all values used
